skos:ConceptScheme.dc:description: Qualifier is a common, cross-class attribute that refines the Measurand definition.

skos:Concept.skos:definition: Maximum value of the measurand
Minimum value of the measurand
Average value of the measurand
Median value of the measurand
Difference of two measurands
Pertaining to the total of multiple instances
High value from a set
Low value from a set
Input value at which output is maximum
Input value at which output is half maximum
Obtained from the source data using processing, computation, or interpretation
Revised estimate obtained with consideration of additional data or assumptions

Estimated with known inaccuracy. Commonly used for distances in plasma obtained from the travel time under assumption of the probing signal traveling at the speed of light, without accounting for a slower group velocity in plasma
Distributed over an area or an image
Spread due to multiple reflection or refraction of EM wave
Existing in a defined number of distinct individual parts
Defined on a grid of discrete values of independent variables
Defined at a multiple discrete points of independent variables, usually in space
Defined at all values of independent variables, without gaps, usually in space
Variation of a quantity about its mean value
Time series passed through a high-pass filter to remove slow-varying trend
Time derivative of a quantity
Standard deviation of a set of values; a measure of dispersion around the mean value
Difference between measured and true value (related to the systematic error that affects the accuracy)
Multiplied by a scaling factor to bring to a unified scale
A measurand with magnitude and no direction
A measurand that has magnitude and direction in 3D space, commonly represented as directed line
Magnitude of a vector measurand
Direction of a vector measurand
One of the components of the vector measurand in a system of coordinates
One of the measurand vector components in GSM system of coordinates
X-component of the measurand vector in GSM system of coordinates
Y-component of the measurand vector in GSM system of coordinates
Z-component of the measurand vector in GSM system of coordinates
One of the measurand vector components in NED system of coordinates
X-component of the measurand vector in NED system of coordinates
Y-component of the measurand vector in NED system of coordinates
Z-component of the measurand vector in NED system of coordinates
One of the measurand vector components in HDZ system of coordinates
H-component of the measurand vector in HDZ system of coordinates
D-component of the measurand vector in HDZ system of coordinates
Z-component of the measurand vector in HDZ system of coordinates
One of the measurand vector components in ENU system of coordinates (Geographic East-North-Up)
X-component of the measurand vector in ENU system of coordinates
Y-component of the measurand vector in ENU system of coordinates
Z-component of the measurand vector in ENU system of coordinates
One of the measurand vector components in Spacecraft Cartesian system of coordinates
X-component of the measurand vector in Spacecraft Cartesian system of coordinates
Y-component of the measurand vector in Spacecraft Cartesian system of coordinates
Z-component of the measurand vector in Spacecraft Cartesian system of coordinates

skos:Concept.skos:prefLabel: Projection of Vector on a Plane
skos:Concept.skos:definition: Projection of a measurand vector on a plane

skos:Concept.skos:prefLabel: Vector Projection a Plane in NED
skos:Concept.skos:definition: Projection of a measurand vector on a plane in NED system of coordinates

skos:Concept.skos:prefLabel: Vector Projection a XY-Plane in NED
skos:Concept.skos:definition: Projection of a measurand vector on the XY plane in NED system of coordinates

skos:Concept.skos:prefLabel: Vector Projection a Plane in ENU
skos:Concept.skos:definition: Projection of a measurand vector on a plane in ENU system of coordinates

skos:Concept.skos:prefLabel: Vector Projection a XY-Plane in ENU
skos:Concept.skos:definition: Projection of a measurand vector on the XY plane in ENU system of coordinates
A vector in 2D space
Magnitude of a 2D vector
Direction of a 2D vector
In the local tangential plane, angle between direction to geomagnetic (compass) north pole and geographic (true) north pole, positive when compass is east of true north
In the vertical direction
Off the vertical direction
In the same direction as the given reference
In the right angle to the given reference direction
Multi-dimensional array of measurands obtained with respect to a basis in the multidimensional space
An ordered list of multiple related values of the measurand
Sequence of frequencies that are multiple integers of a fundamental frequency
Multiple travels of a probing signal between transmitter, reflection region, and receiver
Two travels of a probing signal between transmitter, reflection region, and receiver
Three travels of a probing signal between transmitter, reflection region, and receiver
Pertaining to specific form or figure of the observed property
Estimate obtained under simplifying assumptions about natural property organization
Estimate obtained under assumption of a parabolic shape
Estimate obtained under assumption of the Chapman function of plasma layer shape
Estimate obtained under assumption of the IRI formalism for describing plasma profile shape
Ratio of two quantities
Root-mean-square measure of the magnitude of observed property variation
Peak-to-peak measure of the magnitude of observed property variation
Quantity per unit measure of an independent variable
Across a unit area dA perpendicular to a look direction, at a particular location r
Within a unit energy band dE at particular energy E
Within a unit passband dF at particular frequency F
Within a unit solid angle of acceptance dI along a particular look direction I
Within a unit time dT at particular time T
Within a unit wavelength dL at a particular wavelength L
Quantity integrated over a range of its independent variable
Surface integral over an area
Integrated over energy variable
Integrated over a passband dE around particular energy E
Integrated over all energies
Integrated over energies above certain energy level
Integrated over energies below certain energy level
Integrated over the frequency variable
Integrated over a passband around a particular frequency F
Integrated over all frequencies
Integrated over the solid angle variable
Integrated within the acceptance solid angle
Integrated over the full sphere of solid angles
Integrated over the hemisphere along a particular look direction
Integrated over a time interval
Integrated over the wavelength variable
Integrated over an interval around a particular wavelength L
Integrated over all wavelengths
Difference between maximum and minimum values of the measurand
A functional description of probabilities assigned to each possible outcome of a random process

A popular class of distributions describing a random statistical process: single-peak, symmetric, bell-shaped probability distribution with two shape parameters, mean (also mode and median) and standard deviation (defining the shape girth)

A specific class of normal probability distribution applicable to particle velocities in ideal gas (where the particles move freely without interacting with one another, except for very brief elastic collisions).

A probability distribution that was developed to describe two-population particle systems (e.g., space plasmas) that combine a classic Maxwell-Boltzmann distribution of velocities in the low-energy band with the power-law distribution of high-energy population velocities; resulting formalism applies well to complex particle systems tending to stationary states out of thermal equilibrium
Acquired in an active experiment that stimulates the feature of interest
Acquired in a passive experiment without stimulating the feature of interest
A value that has been adjusted to calibrate or compensate for varying conditions
A entity that represents behavior of a different entity
A classifier into a specific set of categories or classes
